Protocols/DelegateForSimplifiedBrainCont.name: simplifiedSetupForBrainControlFinished(withBrainControl:completion:)
Protocols/DelegateForSimplifiedBrainCont.abstract: SimplifiedBrainControlViewController calls this on its delegate once setting up brain control has finished.

Extensions/RawRepresentable.html#/s:SY12.name: caseCount
Extensions/RawRepresentable.html#/s:SY12.abstract: For a RawRepresentable, the caseCount of EnumAsSettingProtocol equals the number of possible raw values.

Extensions/RawRepresentable.html#/s:SY12.name: valueAt(index:)
Extensions/RawRepresentable.html#/s:SY12.abstract: For a RawRepresentable, the valueAt:index of EnumAsSettingProtocol equals the RawRepresentable with the index as its raw value.

Extensions/RawRepresentable.html.name: RawRepresentable
Extensions/RawRepresentable.html.abstract: This extension makes it easier to conform to EnumAsSettingProtocol.

Enums/NoiseTagMode.html#/s:12NoiseTaggin.name: TrainGeneric
Enums/NoiseTagMode.html#/s:12NoiseTaggin.abstract: Calibration in any context, as long as there are controls available.

Enums/NoiseTagMode.html#/s:12NoiseTaggin.name: TrainSimple
Enums/NoiseTagMode.html#/s:12NoiseTaggin.abstract: Calibration in a simple, framework provided UI.

Enums/NoiseTagMode.html#/s:12NoiseTaggin.name: TrainCustom
Enums/NoiseTagMode.html#/s:12NoiseTaggin.abstract: Calibration as part of a client-defined flow.

Enums/NoiseTagMode.html#/s:12NoiseTaggin.name: Verify
Enums/NoiseTagMode.html#/s:12NoiseTaggin.abstract: Prediction, but with highlighted targets which the user should try to press.

Enums/NoiseTagMode.html#/s:12NoiseTaggin.name: ElectrodeQuality
Enums/NoiseTagMode.html#/s:12NoiseTaggin.abstract: Showing electrode qualities in the Headset screen.

Enums/NoiseTagMode.html#/s:12NoiseTaggin.name: SignalQuality
Enums/NoiseTagMode.html#/s:12NoiseTaggin.abstract: Showing signal qualities in the Headset screen.

Enums/NoiseTagMode.html#/s:12NoiseTaggin.name: DataCollection
Enums/NoiseTagMode.html#/s:12NoiseTaggin.abstract: Optimized for data collection: targets are highlighted and the user should look at them. Trials have a fixed duration. No prediction.

Enums/CornerViewMode.html#/s:12NoiseTagg.name: Sync
Enums/CornerViewMode.html#/s:12NoiseTagg.abstract: The corner view is used for syncing. This means it blinks white on each noise tag start.

Enums/CornerViewMode.html#/s:12NoiseTagg.name: Target
Enums/CornerViewMode.html#/s:12NoiseTagg.abstract: The corner view shows the same flicker as the current target, if there is any.

Enums/CornerViewMode.html#/s:12NoiseTagg.name: Custom
Enums/CornerViewMode.html#/s:12NoiseTagg.abstract: The corner view shows the same flicker as a user-defined control.

Enums/ContrastMode.html#/s:12NoiseTaggin.name: colorBitOn
Enums/ContrastMode.html#/s:12NoiseTaggin.abstract: The color for a noise tag’s on-bits given this contrast mode and colorBitOnIfMaxContrast setting.

Enums/ContrastMode.html#/s:12NoiseTaggin.name: colorBitOff
Enums/ContrastMode.html#/s:12NoiseTaggin.abstract: The color for a noise tag’s off-bits given this contrast mode and colorBitOnIfMaxContrast setting.

Enums/ClickFeedbackMode.html#/s:12NoiseT.name: NonselectedGray
Enums/ClickFeedbackMode.html#/s:12NoiseT.abstract: The pressed control temporarily becomes white, while all other controls temporarily become gray.

Enums/ClickFeedbackMode.html#/s:12NoiseT.name: RedBorder
Enums/ClickFeedbackMode.html#/s:12NoiseT.abstract: Temporarily a red border is shown around the pressed control.

Enums/ClickFeedbackMode.html.name: ClickFeedbackMode
Enums/ClickFeedbackMode.html.abstract: Possible types of feedback when buttons are pressed.

Enums/CornerViewMode.html.name: CornerViewMode
Enums/CornerViewMode.html.abstract: The different ways a corner view can be used.

Enums/NoiseTagMode.html.name: NoiseTagMode
Enums/NoiseTagMode.html.abstract: The different modes NoiseTagging can be in. This mode determines what NoiseTagging is used for.

Other%20Global%20Variables.html#/s:12Noi.name: kDefaultHeightNoiseTagButton
Other%20Global%20Variables.html#/s:12Noi.abstract: Default height for noise tagging buttons, based on the device’s screen size.

Other%20Global%20Variables.html#/s:12Noi.name: kDefaultWidthNoiseTagButton
Other%20Global%20Variables.html#/s:12Noi.abstract: Default width for noise tagging buttons, based on the device’s screen size.

Protocols/SettingObserver.html#/c:@M@Noi.name: valueChangedFor(setting:)
Protocols/SettingObserver.html#/c:@M@Noi.abstract: Whenever a Setting‘s value changes, it calls this on each of its observers.

Classes/Setting_abstract.html#/c:@M@Nois.name: title
Classes/Setting_abstract.html#/c:@M@Nois.abstract: The setting’s title, as displayed in the UI.

Classes/Setting_abstract.html#/c:@M@Nois.name: isEditable
Classes/Setting_abstract.html#/c:@M@Nois.abstract: Whether the settings is editable by the user.

Classes/Setting_abstract.html#/c:@M@Nois.name: isVisibleInUI
Classes/Setting_abstract.html#/c:@M@Nois.abstract: If the setting is part of a SetOfSettings and UI is displayed to edit that set, this determines whether the setting is also visible in the UI.

Classes/Setting_abstract.html#/c:@M@Nois.name: help
Classes/Setting_abstract.html#/c:@M@Nois.abstract: An explanation for the user about what the setting exactly is about.

Classes/Setting_abstract.html#/c:@M@Nois.name: observers
Classes/Setting_abstract.html#/c:@M@Nois.abstract: A setting’s observers are informed whenever the setting’s value changes.

Classes/Setting_abstract.html#/c:@M@Nois.name: validityCheck
Classes/Setting_abstract.html#/c:@M@Nois.abstract: A closure which checks whether a certain value is a valid value for the setting.

Classes/Setting_abstract.html#/c:@M@Nois.name: actionBeforeChange
Classes/Setting_abstract.html#/c:@M@Nois.abstract: An optional closures that is executed just before changing the setting’s value:

Classes/Setting_abstract.html#/c:@M@Nois.name: actionAfterChange
Classes/Setting_abstract.html#/c:@M@Nois.abstract: An optional closures that is executed just after changing the setting’s value:

Classes/Setting_abstract.html#/c:@M@Nois.name: allowsUndefined
Classes/Setting_abstract.html#/c:@M@Nois.abstract: Whether the setting allows to be undefined.

Classes/Setting_abstract.html#/c:@M@Nois.name: isUndefined
Classes/Setting_abstract.html#/c:@M@Nois.abstract: Whether the setting is ‘undefined’. Only relevant if allowsUndefined is true.

Classes/Setting_abstract.html#/c:@M@Nois.name: descriptionValue
Classes/Setting_abstract.html#/c:@M@Nois.abstract: Subclasses should NOT override descriptionValue. Instead they should implement descriptionValueIfDefined.

Classes/Setting_abstract.html#/c:@M@Nois.name: add(observer:)
Classes/Setting_abstract.html#/c:@M@Nois.abstract: Add a new observer, which is informed whenever the setting’s value changes.

Classes/Setting_abstract.html#/c:@M@Nois.name: remove(observer:)
Classes/Setting_abstract.html#/c:@M@Nois.abstract: Remove an observer, so it is no longer informed whenever the setting’s value changes.

Classes/PickableColor.html#/s:12NoiseTag.name: init(displayName:color:)
Classes/PickableColor.html#/s:12NoiseTag.abstract: Initialize a new PickableColor, with the passed displayName and color.

Classes/PickableColor.html#/s:12NoiseTag.name: init(displayName:r255:g255:b255:alpha:)
Classes/PickableColor.html#/s:12NoiseTag.abstract: Initialize a new PickableColor, with the passed displayName and a color with the passed RGB values.

Classes/ColorSetting.html#/s:12NoiseTagg.name: init(title:color:isEditable:help:)
Classes/ColorSetting.html#/s:12NoiseTagg.abstract: Initialize a new ColorSetting, using a RGBA color instead of pickable colors.

Classes/ColorSetting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTag.name: descriptionValueIfDefined
Classes/ColorSetting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTag.abstract: A description of the setting’s value, assuming a value is defined. Used for logging purposes.

Classes/ColorSetting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTag.name: updateValueToMatch(newSetting:)
Classes/ColorSetting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTag.abstract: Sets the receiver’s setting value to the setting value of newSetting.

Classes/ColorSetting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTag.name: hasDefaultValue
Classes/ColorSetting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTag.abstract: Settings may have a default value, which can easily be restored by the user using the standard UI for editing settings provided by the NoiseTagging framework.

Classes/ColorSetting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTag.name: resetToDefault()
Classes/ColorSetting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTag.abstract: Set the setting value to the default value.

Classes/ColorSetting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTag.name: cellNibName
Classes/ColorSetting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTag.abstract: The name of the nib used for generating UI for editing the setting.

Classes/ColorSetting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTag.name: cellReuseIdentifier
Classes/ColorSetting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTag.abstract: The NoiseTagging framework provides standard UI for editing settings. This UI consists of a table view, where each cell is used for one setting. The cellReuseIdentifier makes it possible to reuse these cells per setting type.

Classes/ItemOfArraySetting.html#/s:12Noi.name: indexInitialValue
Classes/ItemOfArraySetting.html#/s:12Noi.abstract: The index of the initial value. This is remembered so the user can always restore it.

Classes/ItemOfArraySetting.html#/s:12Noi.name: indexValue
Classes/ItemOfArraySetting.html#/s:12Noi.abstract: The index of the setting’s current value.

Classes/ItemOfArraySetting.html#/s:12Noi.name: numberOfPossibleValues
Classes/ItemOfArraySetting.html#/s:12Noi.abstract: The number of possible values the setting can have.

Classes/ItemOfArraySetting.html#/s:12Noi.name: select(value:)
Classes/ItemOfArraySetting.html#/s:12Noi.abstract: Make the passed value the setting’s current value.

Classes/ItemOfArraySetting.html#/s:12Noi.name: selectValueWith(displayName:)
Classes/ItemOfArraySetting.html#/s:12Noi.abstract: Search for a possible value with the passed displayName and make it the setting’s current value.

Classes/ItemOfArraySetting.html#/c:@M@No.name: descriptionValueIfDefined
Classes/ItemOfArraySetting.html#/c:@M@No.abstract: A description of the setting’s value, assuming a value is defined. Used for logging purposes.

Classes/ItemOfArraySetting.html#/c:@M@No.name: updateValueToMatch(newSetting:)
Classes/ItemOfArraySetting.html#/c:@M@No.abstract: Sets the receiver’s setting value to the setting value of newSetting.

Classes/ItemOfArraySetting.html#/c:@M@No.name: hasDefaultValue
Classes/ItemOfArraySetting.html#/c:@M@No.abstract: Settings may have a default value, which can easily be restored by the user using the standard UI for editing settings provided by the NoiseTagging framework.

Classes/ItemOfArraySetting.html#/c:@M@No.name: resetToDefault()
Classes/ItemOfArraySetting.html#/c:@M@No.abstract: Set the setting value to the default value.

Classes/ItemOfArraySetting.html#/c:@M@No.name: cellNibName
Classes/ItemOfArraySetting.html#/c:@M@No.abstract: The name of the nib used for generating UI for editing the setting.

Classes/ItemOfArraySetting.html#/c:@M@No.name: cellReuseIdentifier
Classes/ItemOfArraySetting.html#/c:@M@No.abstract: The NoiseTagging framework provides standard UI for editing settings. This UI consists of a table view, where each cell is used for one setting. The cellReuseIdentifier makes it possible to reuse these cells per setting type.

Protocols/EnumAsSetting.html#/s:12NoiseT.name: caseCount
Protocols/EnumAsSetting.html#/s:12NoiseT.abstract: The number of possible cases the enum has.

Protocols/EnumAsSetting.html#/s:12NoiseT.name: valueAt(index:)
Protocols/EnumAsSetting.html#/s:12NoiseT.abstract: The case of the enum at the passed index.

Protocols/EnumAsSetting.html#/s:12NoiseT.name: displayName
Protocols/EnumAsSetting.html#/s:12NoiseT.abstract: A user-friendly description of the enum case.

Protocols/EnumAsSetting.html#/s:12NoiseT.name: subTitle
Protocols/EnumAsSetting.html#/s:12NoiseT.abstract: An optional sub title for the enum case, which can be used to provide the user with more elaborate information about what the enum case means.

Protocols/EnumAsSetting.html#/s:12NoiseT.name: displayNameAt(index:)
Protocols/EnumAsSetting.html#/s:12NoiseT.abstract: A user-friendly description of the enum case with the passed index.

Classes/EnumSetting.html#/s:12NoiseTaggi.name: initialValue
Classes/EnumSetting.html#/s:12NoiseTaggi.abstract: The setting’s initial value. This is remembered so the user can always restore it.

Classes/EnumSetting.html#/s:12NoiseTaggi.name: displayNameAt(index:)
Classes/EnumSetting.html#/s:12NoiseTaggi.abstract: The user description of the enum value at index.

Classes/EnumSetting.html#/s:12NoiseTaggi.name: setValueWith(rawValue:)
Classes/EnumSetting.html#/s:12NoiseTaggi.abstract: Set as the value the enum with the passed rawValue.

Classes/EnumSetting.html#/s:12NoiseTaggi.name: selectValueWith(displayName:)
Classes/EnumSetting.html#/s:12NoiseTaggi.abstract: Set as the value the enum with the passed displayName.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: showNoiseTagIDsOnControls
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: Whether to show the noise tag IDs on top of the controls. Only for debugging.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: framesPerBit
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: Noise tags can be described as sequences of ones and zeros, where each 1 means white and 0 means black. These ones and zeros we call bits. This setting determines how many frames are used to display one bit. In other words: change this setting to change the speed by which noise tags are being played.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: preferredNFramesPerSecond
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: Preferred frame rate for playing noise tags.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: doubleTapOpensBrainSetup
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: Whether the user can double tap to bring up UI for connecting her brain.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: twoFingerDoubleTapOpensDeveloperScreen
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: Whether the user can double tap with two fingers to open the Developer screen.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: useTapsForTogglingWhetherControlsParticipateInNoiseTagging
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: This is for debugging only.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: filenameNoiseTags
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: The name of the .txt file that defines the noise tags that should be used.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: mode
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: The mode we currently are running.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: leftCornerView
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: Mode of the left corner view.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: leftCornerViewIndexOfNoiseTag
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: Index of noise tag that should be used when using the ‘Custom’ mode for the left corner view.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: rightCornerView
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: Mode of the right corner view.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: rightCornerViewIndexOfNoiseTag
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: Index of noise tag that should be used when using the ‘Custom’ mode for the right corner view.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: clickSoundOnPress
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: Whether a click sound should be played whenever pressing a noise tag control. This defines the default behaviour, which can be overridden for specific controls using NoiseTagControl‘s playClickSoundOnPress.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: enableOtherSounds
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: Whether NoiseTagging should play sounds other than click sounds.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: contrastMode
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: The contrast used for making controls flicker.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: voice
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: The voice used by NoiseTagging’s text-to-speech system.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: speechRate
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: The speech rate used by NoiseTagging’s text-to-speech system.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: disableNoClicks
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: Whether to disable ‘no-clicks’.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: assignNoiseTagsInReversedOrder
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: Whether to assign noise tags to controls in reversed order.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: randomlyTranslateNoiseTagsInTraining
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: In subsequent calibration trials we use noise tag x, then noise tag x+1, etcetera. If this setting is false, x=0, otherwise it is chosen randomly.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: timeInBetweenTrials
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: The time before the flickering starts again after a press.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: certaintyRequiredForPress
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: How certain we want to be that the user is looking at a particular control before we press it.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: trialDurationSimpleTrain
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: The duration that we make a control flicker in each trial, during Simple Calibration.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: trialDurationGenericTrain
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: The duration that we make a control flicker in each trial, during Generic Calibration.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: minTrialDuration
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: The minimal duration of a trial before we may brain-press a control.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: maxTestTrialDuration
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: The maximum duration of a trial.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: disableMaxTestTrialDuration
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: Whether to allow endless trials. If this is true, a trial can only end by a control being pressed.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: nSimpleTrainTrials
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: Number of trials used for a round of Simple Calibration.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: nGenericTrainTrials
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: Number of trials used for a round of Generic Calibration.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: defaultBackgroundColorPrimary
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: The default primary background color.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: defaultBackgroundColorTopAndBottomBars
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: The default background color in top and bottom bars. See defaultBackgroundColorPrimary.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: defaultBackgroundColorTreeNavigation
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: The default background color in tree navigation UI. See defaultBackgroundColorPrimary.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: defaultColorButtonEnabled
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: The default color of controls when they are enabled and not flickering.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: defaultColorButtonDisabled
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: The default color of controls when they are disabled.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: defaultColorItemsOnPrimaryBackground
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: The default color of non-controls, such as labels, that are shown alongside controls on the primary background color.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: defaultColorItemsOnTopAndBottomBars
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: The default color of non-controls, such as labels, that are shown alongside controls inside top or bottom bars.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: defaultColorItemsInTreeNavigation
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: The default color of non-controls, such as labels, that are shown alongside controls inside tree navigation UI.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: colorButtonNotPressedFeedback
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: Depending on the clickFeedbackMode, at the end of each trial the controls that have not been pressed may temporarily change to this color.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: defaultColorItemsOnButtons
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: The default color of stuff displayed on top of controls.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: colorBitOffIfMaxContrast
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: The ‘off-color’ of flickering controls.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: colorBitOnIfMaxContrast
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: The ‘on-color’ of flickering controls.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: autoDiscoverHostAddressUsingSSDP
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: Whether we use SSDP to automatically discover the ip address of the MA Decoder.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: hostAddressTCP
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: The ip address of the MA Decoder we connect to.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: portTCP
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: The port over which we connect with the MA Decoder.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: autoConnectTCP
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: Whether we automatically try to connect with the MA Decoder.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: timeoutConnectingOverTCP
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: The applied time-out interval when trying to connect with the MA Decoder.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: timeInBetweenAttemptsToConnect
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: After each attempt to connect to the MA Decoder we wait a bit, as defined by this setting, and then try again.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: durationAutoConnectTCPBeforeWarningUser
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: If we do not manage to connect to the MA Decoder for the duration as defined by this setting, we warn the user using an alert.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: soundOnMissedFrame
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: Whether to play a sound whenever a frame is dropped while the controls are flickering.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: clickFeedbackMode
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: Determines the kind of feedback that is provided whenever a control is pressed.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: certaintyRequiredForFirstZeroTrainClick
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: In zero-train mode, the certainty that is required for performing the first press.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: maxDurationFirstZeroTrainClick
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: In zero-train mode, the maximum duration of the first press.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: nZeroTrainTrials
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: In zero-train mode, the number of trials in which calibration takes place.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: hideNonTargetControls
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: During Generic Calibration, whether the controls that are not the target should be hidden.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: soundAlarmWhenDisconnecting
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: Whether an alarm sound should be played whenever we disconnect from the MA Decoder (unless the user disconnects deliberately).

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: sayOutLoudWhenSendingModeToUtopia
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: Undocumented

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: ttsFailedClicks
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: Undocumented

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: playSoundAfterNoiseTaggingOn
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: Undocumented

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: intervalPlaySoundAfterNoiseTaggingOn
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: Undocumented

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.name: labeledButtonsOnlyPartlyFlicker
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html#/s:12.abstract: Undocumented

Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.name: title
Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.abstract: The setting’s title, as displayed in the UI.

Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.name: isEditable
Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.abstract: Whether the settings is editable by the user.

Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.name: isVisibleInUI
Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.abstract: If the setting is part of a SetOfSettings and UI is displayed to edit that set, this determines whether the setting is also visible in the UI.

Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.name: help
Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.abstract: An explanation for the user about what the setting exactly is about.

Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.name: observers
Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.abstract: A setting’s observers are informed whenever the setting’s value changes.

Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.name: add(observer:)
Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.abstract: Add a new observer, which is informed whenever the setting’s value changes.

Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.name: remove(observer:)
Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.abstract: Remove an observer, so it is no longer informed whenever the setting’s value changes.

Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.name: valueAsJson
Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.abstract: The setting’s value described using JSON. Used for logging purposes.

Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.name: descriptionValueIfDefined
Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.abstract: A description of the setting’s value, assuming a value is defined. Used for logging purposes.

Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.name: descriptionValue
Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.abstract: A description of the setting’s value, be it defined or undefined. Used for logging purposes.

Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.name: updateValueToMatch(newSetting:)
Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.abstract: Sets the receiver’s setting value to the setting value of newSetting.

Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.name: hasDefaultValue
Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.abstract: Settings may have a default value, which can easily be restored by the user using the standard UI for editing settings provided by the NoiseTagging framework.

Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.name: resetToDefault()
Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.abstract: Set the setting value to the default value.

Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.name: cellNibName
Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.abstract: The name of the nib used for generating UI for editing the setting.

Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.name: cellReuseIdentifier
Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.abstract: The NoiseTagging framework provides standard UI for editing settings. This UI consists of a table view, where each cell is used for one setting. The cellReuseIdentifier makes it possible to reuse these cells per setting type.

Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.name: validityCheck
Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.abstract: A closure which checks whether a certain value is a valid value for the setting.

Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.name: actionBeforeChange
Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.abstract: An optional closures that is executed just before changing the setting’s value:

Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.name: actionAfterChange
Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.abstract: An optional closures that is executed just after changing the setting’s value:

Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.name: allowsUndefined
Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.abstract: Whether the setting allows to be undefined.

Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.name: isUndefined
Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.abstract: Whether the setting is ‘undefined’. Only relevant if allowsUndefined is true.

Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.name: setToUndefined()
Protocols/Setting.html#/c:@M@NoiseTaggin.abstract: Set the setting value to undefined.

Protocols/Setting.html.name: Setting
Protocols/Setting.html.abstract: Objects conforming to this protocol can be used as Settings. This a.o. means they have a value that can be set and get, and that the NoiseTagging framework can provide the user with UI to edit the setting.

Classes/NoiseTagSetOfSettings.html.name: NoiseTagSetOfSettings
Classes/NoiseTagSetOfSettings.html.abstract: Used for modeling NoiseTagController’s settings. Note that this class does not control which specific settings are added to it. To get an overview of the settings that NoiseTagController uses, see NoiseTagSettingTitles.

Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html.name: NoiseTagSettingTitles
Structs/NoiseTagSettingTitles.html.abstract: Struct containing titles of settings used by the NoiseTagging framework.

Protocols/EnumAsSetting.html.name: EnumAsSetting
Protocols/EnumAsSetting.html.abstract: Enums that implement EnumAsSettingProtocol can be used as values for EnumSetting.

Classes/ItemOfArraySetting.html.name: ItemOfArraySetting
Classes/ItemOfArraySetting.html.abstract: A Setting which models an array of possible values and one of those values being selected.

Protocols/ItemOfArrayInMenu.html.name: ItemOfArrayInMenu
Protocols/ItemOfArrayInMenu.html.abstract: By conforming to this protocol, the NoiseTagging framework can display objects in a menu, letting the user select one of multiple objects. This protocol is also used for ItemOfArraySetting.

Classes/PickableColor.html.name: PickableColor
Classes/PickableColor.html.abstract: A PickableColor models a color that can be selected as a ColorSetting‘s current value.

Classes/Setting_abstract.html.name: Setting_abstract
Classes/Setting_abstract.html.abstract: Setting classes can subclass this abstract class to more easily implement the Setting protocol.

Protocols/SettingObserver.html.name: SettingObserver
Protocols/SettingObserver.html.abstract: Each Setting can have one or more observers, which are informed whenever the setting changes value.

Enums/StandardCustomizableKeyboardButton.name: SpecialCharacters
Enums/StandardCustomizableKeyboardButton.abstract: A button which can be used to type special characters such as “.” or “,”.

Enums/StandardCustomizableKeyboardButton.name: SpeakOutOrUndo
Enums/StandardCustomizableKeyboardButton.abstract: A button which can be used to speak out loud the entered text, or if the text has just been deleted, undo that.

Enums/StandardCustomizableKeyboardButton.name: Ready
Enums/StandardCustomizableKeyboardButton.abstract: A button which can be used to stop editing the text.

Enums/CustomizableButtonState.html#/s:12.name: standard(_:)
Enums/CustomizableButtonState.html#/s:12.abstract: One of the standard buttons, as defined by StandardCustomizableButton.

Enums/CustomizableButtonState.html#/s:12.name: custom(view:idInKeyboard:)
Enums/CustomizableButtonState.html#/s:12.abstract: A custom button, which is defined by a view and an identifier.

Structs/NoiseTagKeyboardSettingTitles.ht.name: keyboardLayout
Structs/NoiseTagKeyboardSettingTitles.ht.abstract: What keyboard layout to use, as defined by LettersLayoutType.

Structs/NoiseTagKeyboardSettingTitles.ht.name: autoCompleteMode
Structs/NoiseTagKeyboardSettingTitles.ht.abstract: What auto complete mode to use, as defined by AutoCompleteMode.

Structs/NoiseTagKeyboardSettingTitles.ht.name: ttsMode
Structs/NoiseTagKeyboardSettingTitles.ht.abstract: What text to speech mode to use, as defined by SpeakOutLoudMode.

Structs/NoiseTagKeyboardSettingTitles.ht.name: languageCodeWordCompletion
Structs/NoiseTagKeyboardSettingTitles.ht.abstract: What language to use for word completion.

Structs/NoiseTagKeyboardSettingTitles.ht.name: whenAcceptingWordCompletionsOnSpaceOnlySuggestIfCurrentTextIsNoWord
Structs/NoiseTagKeyboardSettingTitles.ht.abstract: Whether to allow word completion by typing a space when a valid word already has been typed.

Protocols/NoiseTaggingKeyboardDelegate.h.name: readyButtonPressedInKeyboard()
Protocols/NoiseTaggingKeyboardDelegate.h.abstract: Called when the user presses the keyboard’s Ready button. Normally the delegate should dismiss the NoiseTagKeyboardViewController.

Classes/NoiseTagKeyboardViewController.h.name: delegate
Classes/NoiseTagKeyboardViewController.h.abstract: The delegate can respond to button presses. It is also responsible for dismissing the keyboard when the Ready button is pressed.

Classes/NoiseTagKeyboardViewController.h.name: customizableButtonStates
Classes/NoiseTagKeyboardViewController.h.abstract: 1, 2, or 3 buttons that are displayed in the customizable area of the keyboard.

Classes/NoiseTagKeyboardViewController.h.name: NoiseTagKeyboardViewController
Classes/NoiseTagKeyboardViewController.h.abstract: A view controller which presents a brain-controllable keyboard.

Enums/CustomizableButtonState.html.name: CustomizableButtonState
Enums/CustomizableButtonState.html.abstract: Enum defining the possible buttons that can be used to customize the keyboard of a NoiseTagKeyboardViewController.

Enums/StandardCustomizableKeyboardButton.name: StandardCustomizableKeyboardButton
Enums/StandardCustomizableKeyboardButton.abstract: Enum defining the different standard buttons that can be used to customize the keyboard of a NoiseTagKeyboardViewController.

Classes/NoiseTagPopupItem.html#/s:12Nois.name: image
Classes/NoiseTagPopupItem.html#/s:12Nois.abstract: An optional image displayed next to the title.

Classes/NoiseTagPopupItem.html#/s:12Nois.name: associatedValue
Classes/NoiseTagPopupItem.html#/s:12Nois.abstract: An optional value associated with the item.

Classes/NoiseTagPopupItem.html#/s:12Nois.name: init(title:image:associatedValue:)
Classes/NoiseTagPopupItem.html#/s:12Nois.abstract: Initialize a new NoiseTagPopupItem, with the passed title, image, and associatedValue.

Classes/NoiseTagPopupButtonView.html#/s:.name: items
Classes/NoiseTagPopupButtonView.html#/s:.abstract: The possible items that the user can select.

Classes/NoiseTagPopupButtonView.html#/s:.name: isHorizontal
Classes/NoiseTagPopupButtonView.html#/s:.abstract: Whether the items are presented horizontally instead of vertically.

Classes/NoiseTagPopupButtonView.html#/s:.name: noiseTagControlIsOn
Classes/NoiseTagPopupButtonView.html#/s:.abstract: Whether noise tagging control is currently enabled.

Classes/NoiseTagPopupButtonView.html#/s:.name: closureToHandleSelectionOfItem
Classes/NoiseTagPopupButtonView.html#/s:.abstract: This closure is executed whenever the user selects an item. The closure is passed the selected item.

Classes/NoiseTagPopupButtonView.html#/s:.name: fontItems
Classes/NoiseTagPopupButtonView.html#/s:.abstract: The font used for displaying the item titles.

Classes/NoiseTagPopupButtonView.html#/s:.name: title
Classes/NoiseTagPopupButtonView.html#/s:.abstract: This function overrides NoiseTagLabeledButtonView‘s implementation, only to print a warning that this can better not be used directly. Instead you should set items, and indexSelectedItem or selectedItem.

Classes/NoiseTagPopupButtonView.html#/s:.name: init(frame:locationLabel:)
Classes/NoiseTagPopupButtonView.html#/s:.abstract: Initialize a new NoiseTagPopupButtonView, given the passed frame and locationLabel.

Classes/NoiseTagPopupButtonView.html#/s:.name: showPopover()
Classes/NoiseTagPopupButtonView.html#/s:.abstract: Show the popover in which the user can choose which item to select.

Classes/NoiseTagPopupButtonView.html#/s:.name: selectItemWithAssociatedValue(value:)
Classes/NoiseTagPopupButtonView.html#/s:.abstract: Each item (NoiseTagPopupItem) may have an associated value, which is of any type. Select the item with the passed associated value.

Classes/NoiseTagPopupButtonView.html#/c:.name: startNoiseTagControlOn(noiseTaggingView:)
Classes/NoiseTagPopupButtonView.html#/c:.abstract: When a NoiseTagPopupButtonView, it presents a popover and pushes a new unit on the noise tagging stack. It becomes this unit’s delegate. In this NoiseTagDelegate function is prepare the popover’s contents for noise tagging control.

Classes/NoiseTagLabeledButtonView/Locati.name: LocationLabel
Classes/NoiseTagLabeledButtonView/Locati.abstract: The location of the label of a NoiseTagLabeledButtonView.

Classes/NoiseTagLabeledButtonView.html#/.name: title
Classes/NoiseTagLabeledButtonView.html#/.abstract: The title displayed on top of the button.

Classes/NoiseTagLabeledButtonView.html#/.name: subTitle
Classes/NoiseTagLabeledButtonView.html#/.abstract: The subtitle displayed on top of the button.

Classes/NoiseTagLabeledButtonView.html#/.name: image
Classes/NoiseTagLabeledButtonView.html#/.abstract: The image displayed on top of the button.

Classes/NoiseTagLabeledButtonView.html#/.name: font
Classes/NoiseTagLabeledButtonView.html#/.abstract: The font of the title displayed on top of the button.

Classes/NoiseTagLabeledButtonView.html#/.name: textAlignment
Classes/NoiseTagLabeledButtonView.html#/.abstract: The text alignment of the title displayed on top of the button.

Classes/NoiseTagLabeledButtonView.html#/.name: updateUIDependingOnNoiseTagging()
Classes/NoiseTagLabeledButtonView.html#/.abstract: We override this in order to hide the line that divides our two parts when flickering is on.

Classes/NoiseTagShapeButtonView.html#/s:.name: color
Classes/NoiseTagShapeButtonView.html#/s:.abstract: Our color if we are not flickering.

Classes/NoiseTagButtonView.html#/s:12Noi.name: titleLabel
Classes/NoiseTagButtonView.html#/s:12Noi.abstract: The label used to show the button’s title.

Classes/NoiseTagButtonView.html#/s:12Noi.name: title
Classes/NoiseTagButtonView.html#/s:12Noi.abstract: The title displayed on top of the button.

Classes/NoiseTagButtonView.html#/s:12Noi.name: subTitle
Classes/NoiseTagButtonView.html#/s:12Noi.abstract: The subtitle displayed on top of the button.

Classes/NoiseTagButtonView.html#/s:12Noi.name: image
Classes/NoiseTagButtonView.html#/s:12Noi.abstract: The image displayed on top of the button.

Classes/NoiseTagButtonView.html#/s:12Noi.name: imageOffset
Classes/NoiseTagButtonView.html#/s:12Noi.abstract: The offset of the image displayed on top of the button.

Classes/NoiseTagButtonView.html#/s:12Noi.name: fontOfTitle
Classes/NoiseTagButtonView.html#/s:12Noi.abstract: The font of the title displayed on top of the button.

Classes/NoiseTagButtonView.html#/s:12Noi.name: fontOfSubTitle
Classes/NoiseTagButtonView.html#/s:12Noi.abstract: The font of the subtitle displayed on top of the button.

Classes/NoiseTagButtonView.html#/s:12Noi.name: textAlignment
Classes/NoiseTagButtonView.html#/s:12Noi.abstract: The text alignment of the title displayed on top of the button.

Classes/NoiseTagButtonView.html#/s:12Noi.name: labelColor
Classes/NoiseTagButtonView.html#/s:12Noi.abstract: Buttons can have a label, which is a colored circle displayed on top of the button.

Classes/NoiseTagButtonView.html#/s:12Noi.name: titleColor
Classes/NoiseTagButtonView.html#/s:12Noi.abstract: The color of the title displayed on top of the button.

Classes/NoiseTagButtonView.html#/s:12Noi.name: subTitleColor
Classes/NoiseTagButtonView.html#/s:12Noi.abstract: The color of the subtitle displayed on top of the button.

Classes/NoiseTagButtonView.html#/c:@M@No.name: show(appearance:withDefaultColor:)
Classes/NoiseTagButtonView.html#/c:@M@No.abstract: Implementation of NoiseTagControl‘s setFlickerColor(color) function. We simply set the passed color as our layer’s background color.

Classes/NoiseTagButtonView.html#/s:12Noi.name: valueChangedOf(setting:inSet:)
Classes/NoiseTagButtonView.html#/s:12Noi.abstract: In order to keep our appearance in line with changing settings, we implement SettingSubscriber.

Classes/NoiseTagButtonView.html#/c:@M@No.name: layoutSubviews()
Classes/NoiseTagButtonView.html#/c:@M@No.abstract: We override layoutSubviews to keep our layout correct whenever our bounds change.

Classes/NoiseTagButtonView.html.name: NoiseTagButtonView
Classes/NoiseTagButtonView.html.abstract: A button with either a title or an image.

Classes/NoiseTagShapeButtonView.html.name: NoiseTagShapeButtonView
Classes/NoiseTagShapeButtonView.html.abstract: A NoiseTagButtonView, but with a shape defined by a CGPath instead of a regular rectangle.

Classes/NoiseTagLabeledButtonView.html.name: NoiseTagLabeledButtonView
Classes/NoiseTagLabeledButtonView.html.abstract: A noisetagging button consisting of two parts: a flickering part with an image, and an optionally non-flickering part with a title.

Classes/NoiseTagPopupButtonView.html.name: NoiseTagPopupButtonView
Classes/NoiseTagPopupButtonView.html.abstract: A NoiseTagLabeledButtonView which when pressed lets the user pick one out of a list of possible items in a popover.

Classes/NoiseTagPopupItem.html.name: NoiseTagPopupItem
Classes/NoiseTagPopupItem.html.abstract: Used for modeling the items a user can choose from in a NoiseTagPopupButtonView.

Protocols/NoiseTagDelegate.html#/c:@M@No.name: startNoiseTagControlOn(noiseTaggingView:)
Protocols/NoiseTagDelegate.html#/c:@M@No.abstract: When a unit becomes the current unit because it has been pushed, or because another unit was popped , or if NoiseTagging.update(view:forNoiseTaggingWithDelegate:) is called, NoiseTagging calls this function on the delegate.

Protocols/NoiseTagDelegate.html#/c:@M@No.name: contextDescription()
Protocols/NoiseTagDelegate.html#/c:@M@No.abstract: Called after each update for logging purposes. If the delegate returns a context description, this is logged.

Protocols/NoiseTagDelegate.html#/c:@M@No.name: respondToNoClick()
Protocols/NoiseTagDelegate.html#/c:@M@No.abstract: Called whenever a trial ends because the maximum trial duration has passed and no control is being pressed.

Protocols/NoiseTagDelegate.html#/c:@M@No.name: customBackgroundColorFor(view:)
Protocols/NoiseTagDelegate.html#/c:@M@No.abstract: Optionally define an alternative background color for the view. By default the color is defined by NoiseTagController‘s defaultBackgroundColorPrimary setting.

Protocols/NoiseTagDelegate.html#/c:@M@No.name: idsOfControlsToIncludeAsTargetInVerifyMode(noiseTaggingView:)
Protocols/NoiseTagDelegate.html#/c:@M@No.abstract: In some modes the framework randomly selects one of the controls as the target. By implementing this function, the delegate can limit the set of controls that can be selected as the target.

Protocols/NoiseTagDelegate.html#/c:@M@No.name: nextTarget()
Protocols/NoiseTagDelegate.html#/c:@M@No.abstract: This is part of functionality that will become available later on.

Protocols/NoiseTagDelegate.html#/c:@M@No.name: thereWillBeANextTarget()
Protocols/NoiseTagDelegate.html#/c:@M@No.abstract: This is part of functionality that will become available later on.

Protocols/NoiseTagDelegate.html#/c:@M@No.name: trialEnded()
Protocols/NoiseTagDelegate.html#/c:@M@No.abstract: This is part of functionality that will become available later on.

Classes/NoiseTagControlProperties.html#/.name: playClickSoundOnPress
Classes/NoiseTagControlProperties.html#/.abstract: Whether a click sound should be played when the control is pressed.

Classes/NoiseTagControlProperties.html#/.name: addAction(timing:closure:)
Classes/NoiseTagControlProperties.html#/.abstract: Add an action. All of a control’s actions are executed when the control is pressed, be it by brain or by touch.

Protocols/NoiseTagControl.html#/c:@M@Noi.name: show(appearance:withDefaultColor:)
Protocols/NoiseTagControl.html#/c:@M@Noi.abstract: This function is called by NoiseTagging to show a noise tag on the control.

Protocols/NoiseTagControl.html#/c:@M@Noi.name: setFeedbackColor(color:)
Protocols/NoiseTagControl.html#/c:@M@Noi.abstract: This function is called by NoiseTagging to show feedback colors on the control, for example for highlighting indicating that the user should look at the control during calibration , or for providing visual feedback when there is a button press. By default UIView calls setFlickerColor(color:), passing this color, or if the color is nil, it calls self.updateUIDependingOnNoiseTagging().

Protocols/NoiseTagControl.html#/c:@M@Noi.name: layerToHandleNoiseTagTaps()
Protocols/NoiseTagControl.html#/c:@M@Noi.abstract: In order to allow the user to press buttons using touch, the framework performs a simple kind of hit test. A tap is considered to be on a control if it is in the bounds of the layer returned by this function. By default UIView simply returns its layer.

Protocols/NoiseTagControl.html#/c:@M@Noi.name: layerForFeedbackAnimations()
Protocols/NoiseTagControl.html#/c:@M@Noi.abstract: The framework applies a number of animations to controls. For example it might make a control ‘wiggle’ to indicate that the user should look at, or it might animate a control’s size when it is pressed by touch. These animations are applied to the layer returned by this function. By default UIView simply returns its layer.

Protocols/NoiseTagControl.html#/c:@M@Noi.name: layerFlickeringPart()
Protocols/NoiseTagControl.html#/c:@M@Noi.abstract: The framework may use Metal for drawing the parts of the UI that actually flicker. If Metal is used, for each control the contents of the layer returned by this function is what is drawn using Metal, in a view on top of everything else. By default UIView simply returns its layer.

Protocols/NoiseTagControl.html#/c:@M@Noi.name: isHiddenOrIsInHiddenView
Protocols/NoiseTagControl.html#/c:@M@Noi.abstract: The hit test applied by layerToHandleNoiseTagTaps always fails if this function returns true. Also, brain presses are only possible on controls for which this returns false. This prevents that controls that are in the view hierarchy, invisible but enabled, be it by accident or on purpose, can still be pressed. By default UIView returns false only if its isHidden property is false and the same holds for all of its super views.

Protocols/NoiseTagControl.html#/c:@M@Noi.name: updateUIDependingOnNoiseTagging()
Protocols/NoiseTagControl.html#/c:@M@Noi.abstract: This function allows controls to respond when the state of NoiseTagging changes in some way that might be relevant for their appearance. Currently this only is called when the flickering starts or stops. UIView‘s default implementation is as follows:

Protocols/NoiseTagControl.html#/c:@M@Noi.name: participatesInFlickering_didChangeValue()
Protocols/NoiseTagControl.html#/c:@M@Noi.abstract: Allows controls to respond when the value of self.noiseTagging.participatesInFlickering changes.

Protocols/NoiseTagControl.html#/c:@M@Noi.name: noiseTagControlIsEnabled_didChangeValue()
Protocols/NoiseTagControl.html#/c:@M@Noi.abstract: Allows controls to respond when the value of self.noiseTagging.enabled changes.

Protocols/NoiseTagControl.html#/s:12Nois.name: defaultColorWhenEnabled
Protocols/NoiseTagControl.html#/s:12Nois.abstract: Convenience var for getting the default color that controls have if they are enabled but not flickering.

Protocols/NoiseTagControl.html#/s:12Nois.name: defaultColorWhenDisabled
Protocols/NoiseTagControl.html#/s:12Nois.abstract: Convenience var for getting the default color that controls have if they are disabled but not flickering.

Classes/NoiseTagController.html#/s:12Noi.name: colorFor(bit:)
Classes/NoiseTagController.html#/s:12Noi.abstract: The default flicker color to display for either a 1 or a 0 in the noise tag.

Classes/NoiseTagController.html#/s:12Noi.name: push(view:forNoiseTaggingWithDelegate:)
Classes/NoiseTagController.html#/s:12Noi.abstract: Push a new unit on the noise tagging stack.

Classes/NoiseTagController.html#/s:12Noi.name: pop()
Classes/NoiseTagController.html#/s:12Noi.abstract: Pop the current noise tagging unit, making the second-topmost unit the active unit.

Classes/NoiseTagController.html#/s:12Noi.name: update(view:forNoiseTaggingWithDelegate:)
Classes/NoiseTagController.html#/s:12Noi.abstract: Restart noise tagging on the current unit.

Classes/NoiseTagController.html#/s:12Noi.name: blockTrials(forDuration:)
Classes/NoiseTagController.html#/s:12Noi.abstract: Use this function whenever starting the next noise tagging trial should be postponed untill a certain task has been finished.

Classes/NoiseTagController.html#/s:12Noi.name: unblockTrials()
Classes/NoiseTagController.html#/s:12Noi.abstract: This function is the counterpart to blockTrials(forDuration:). You call blockTrials(forDuration:) to postpone starting the next noise tagging trial untill a certain task has been finished. If you do this without passing a duration, you must call unblockTrials once that task is finished.

Classes/NoiseTagController.html#/s:12Noi.name: settings
Classes/NoiseTagController.html#/s:12Noi.abstract: You can use NoiseTagging‘s settings property to customise how the framework operates.

Classes/NoiseTagController.html#/s:12Noi.name: startBrainSetup(pushedFromNavigationController:withCompletionAfterBrainSetup:)
Classes/NoiseTagController.html#/s:12Noi.abstract: Call this function to bring up the standard UI for connecting to the MindAffect Decoder and connecting a brain.

Classes/NoiseTagController.html#/c:@CM@N.name: nFramesPerBit()
Classes/NoiseTagController.html#/c:@CM@N.abstract: In the future this will no longer be public.

Main%20Symbols.html#/s:12NoiseTaggingA2A.name: NoiseTagging
Main%20Symbols.html#/s:12NoiseTaggingA2A.abstract: This provides easy access to the singleton NoiseTagController.

Classes/NoiseTagController.html.name: NoiseTagController
Classes/NoiseTagController.html.abstract: This class provides a singleton NoiseTagController, which is responsible for coordinating everything that has to do with noise tagging. Access the singleton instance using the convenience variable NoiseTagging.

Protocols/NoiseTagControl.html.name: NoiseTagControl
Protocols/NoiseTagControl.html.abstract: Objects conforming to NoiseTagControl are controls. Being a control means being a brain-pressable button.

Classes/NoiseTagControlProperties.html.name: NoiseTagControlProperties
Classes/NoiseTagControlProperties.html.abstract: Each NoiseTagControl has a noiseTagging property of type NoiseTagControlProperties. The purpose of this noiseTagging property is to store a number of things that are needed to make noise tagging work. It is also your main point of access to define how each control behaves as a brain-pressable button.

Protocols/NoiseTagDelegate.html.name: NoiseTagDelegate
Protocols/NoiseTagDelegate.html.abstract: The main responsibility of a NoiseTagDelegate is to prepare a unit for brain control by assigning actions to controls.

Other%20Global%20Variables.html.name: Other Global Variables
Other%20Global%20Variables.html.abstract: The following global variables are available globally.
